intro: Synsepalum muelleri, commonly known as the African star apple, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its elliptical leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits with a yellow or orange skin and a sweet, juicy pulp. The fruit is often used in local cuisines and has medicinal properties. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate.
